item.title: Large trench type pothole on the approach to building site., 18th December
item.description:
Hole in middle of road near white line catching the off side wheels of cars going up the hill. only going to get worse with the heavy building traffic hitting it constantly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains on balcarras lane are blocked, 18th December
item.description:
Rainwater flows down the lane towards East End Road. It is obvious that the run-off from the hills does not adequately drain into any ditch and because the storm drains appear permanently blocked with mud and leaves, this frequently results in a mini-river flowing down towards the school, which then pools into a small pond at the end, by the junction with East End Road. If the weather is freezing in the winter this flood water on the lane can turn into ice, which is particularly hazardous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Balcarras Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drains on balcarras lane are blocked, 18th December
item.description:

item.title: Ambiguous and confusing lane marking. Inconsistent with Highway Code. Hazardous for cyclists in particular., 18th December
item.description:
Road markings on Hatherley Lane travelling from A40 roundabout towards B&Q roundabout are ambiguous, and I would contend are dangerously so, leading to potential accidents. Both lanes currently have straight ahead arrows painted but this makes no sense and is hard to reconcile against Highway Code guidance. I have experienced numerous near misses in a car, and more than one near collision when I've been on a bicycle. Shouldn't the right hand lane be designated for vehicles travelling to Grovefield Way, or the Park & Ride? And left hand lane designated for Hatherley Lane or the B&Q estate?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: I lost my wheel, 18th December
item.description:
I stopped in the location (Three letter word GPS location) "catapult.nerd.keener" which was about 20 seconds from the pothole (I was driving to the north on the road), it was the nearest safe place to park, though still caused traffic obstruction. I did not dare walking to the pothole because it was unsafe. There was another car broken on the road because of another pothole

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked for at least 5yrs, 18th December
item.description:
The drain outside number 9 Gretton Road gotherington has been blocked for a very long time, at least 5yrs, I think our Road is being resurfaced in February at long last so it would make sense to sort this before then .it's no good sending someone out who just looks at it and doesn't sort it,this has happened a few times so it needs someone who knows what they are doing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water flowing across road apron junction, 18th December
item.description:
Water coming out of verge and has been diverted to stop flooding to property, and is now flowing across pavement and apron to Haymes Drive. if this freezes it will cause major problems. Has been a problem on & off for over a year
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haymes Road, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obstruction caused by wall/building problem, 18th December
item.description:
development works are in place, residents have been informed of works with literature around area by council with mapping of what is happening (name on map is Kay moore 28/07/23) showing where alternative path will be/closed/path will be open, unaffected, but fencing that is now physically up does not match the description of work suggested. fencing is on boarder of Westfields property and blocking the pathway with was stated in the literature, would be accessible. path was suppose to be unaffected but now the public rights of way is immediately close to property
Report on FixMyStreet
